choices.name: Get started with research for your Idaho ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Idaho ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine priorities for Idaho research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Idaho research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Idaho Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Follow this research study for Idaho ancestors, from 1850-1910.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Texas Research, 1850-1910

  3. Ancestry: Explore resources for Idaho research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Idaho Resources
    ☆ AC—Idaho State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  4. Record Finder: Use the Idaho Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Idaho Record Selection Table

    5. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

  5. African American: Explore the African American Gateway for Idaho.
Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Idaho in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Idaho
    ☆ FS—Wiki: Idaho Minorities

  2. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Idaho in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Idaho

1. Explore Idaho historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Idaho History

  2. Explore Idaho history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Idaho

  3. Learn about Idaho history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Idaho History

choices.name: Learn about Idaho archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Idaho archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Idaho Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Idaho State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research
  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Idaho.
  3. Explore Idaho Dept. of Archives collection.
  4. Explore Idaho Digital Resources site.
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Idaho genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Search for ☆free online books on Idaho research on the FamilySearch site.
  7. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Idaho ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city and county records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Idaho city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Idaho Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Idaho city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Idaho city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Idaho ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Idaho city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

  2. Explore The Ancestor Hunt for obituaries.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: How to Find Idaho Death Records

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Idaho County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Idaho.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Idaho Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Idaho Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Idaho Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Idaho Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. West Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Idaho.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Idaho research.
  2. Explore the Idaho research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Idaho research.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Idaho in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Idaho Societies
  2. Learn about genealogy societies in Idaho in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Idaho Societies

  3. Explore the Idaho Genealogical Society site.
  4. Explore the Idaho State Historical Society site.
  5. Explore Idaho genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  6. Get help at a family history center in Idaho.
